{"step_by_step_thinking": "Endocarditis is an infection of the inner surface of the heart, usually the valves. The most common cause of endocarditis is a bacterial infection, with streptococci or staphylococci being the most commonly involved bacteria. Risk factors for endocarditis include valvular heart disease, including rheumatic disease, congenital heart disease, artificial valves, intravenous drug use, and electronic pacemakers.
